number of helpful: 10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								The vehicle car shooter I've been waiting for. This is as close as I have come to the old memories of Twisted Metal 2 and Vigilante 8, which were hands down my favorite games in their time. I'm hoping this game will pick up in the next months as more content is added and the car shooter genre is refined once again. Cars - 4 to choose from for now, but each is different and feels like it. Cars are well detailed, especially for such a early release. One thing I would add to each car is somewhat of a back story about the driver. This would let you feel more in touch with the car/driver you chose. Characters with different personalities, and that reflects on the cars they drive and what special weapon/abilities the car has etc. This would tie in perhaps with a story mode, similar to what the old car shooter classic games had. Create some badas*es that makes you want to play them! Weapons  - The feel is a lot like Vigilante 8, especially the mortar and cannon. Good feel to the guns, nice graphics on the guns too. I was surprised by the detail on the weapons. Can't wait to see the special weapon for each car. I'm hoping it kind of ties in with what the car is, or with the character possibly. This will really set cars apart from each other.Maps - All maps are open space right now. Good for a quick death match, nice detail, they aren't too different from each other, cookie-cutter like as it's a similar space size wise just different setting. I'm hoping for an addition of cities, suburban areas, special parts of cities such as air ports etc. (Paris level in Twisted Metal 2 is a good example of what I have in mind) One of the maps in the game has special features that you can interact with to unlock a monster worm to attack. Nice touch, would like to see more interactions with the map and easter eggs. Some of the things I hope to see in the future would be boss cars, car unlockables, secret areas on map, and I do hope that the game ends up with a little more than just 8 cars to choose from, as that's the plan for now. Worth the 2.99, I almost didn't get the game because of the low price! I was thinking this will be a low budget feeling game that runs terrible. I was WRONG. It is worth it and I have my fingers crossed as this game develops. PLEASE don't abandon the project, bring back the car shooter genre!!!

content:
r 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's a good game.I'm bored of FPS games, and there are too many rogue-lites at the moment. This made me think back to what type of game I haven't played in a while, and memories of crushing my brother in Twisted Metal Black and beating Vigilate 8's campaign flooded my mind. This game is almost a year from release at the time of this writing and it's already fun to play. It's not perfect, you can abuse air movement to go faster than you should across the map, but that's also pretty fun. The only real issue is that I bought this too early and not enough people are on. Otherwise you would find me playing this at least as much as Rocket League.Buy the game so I can paralyze your vehicle and stick you with bombs.

content:
r 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								First off, as a disclaimer: I did back this game on IndieGoGo, even though the campaign was ultimately unsuccessful.I love car shooting games. I've grown up on classic 90s games like Mario Kart 64, for the N64, and Twisted Metal, for PS1. With that in mind, "Diesel Guns" is arguably the best modern spiritual successor to these types of retro games thus far.The gameplay is very fun. I love the combat system, everything from the powerups, each of which are fun and cool, to the controls, which are very well implemented. I had no trouble quickly learning the controls.The AI bots seen ingame, when you set up your own matches, are pretty decent, although they do seem to have the attention span of an ADHD child, often losing interest in who they are attacking, or even will remain passive when they themselves are under attack.Before I list the good and bad aspects of this game, I do have to report a rather HUGE problem/bug with this game:The player cannot create their own username, instead it just uses the full name of the computer the player is using, which is compromising information that puts all players at risk, if the wrong person sees that info and decides to hack that PC. THIS NEEDS TO BE FIXED ASAP, PLEASE!That said, here are the good and bad aspects to this game: Good -Fantastic visual style, walking the fine line between realism and cartoony-Great map design-Well-animated vehicle models and combat animations-Easy-to-learn controls-Great sound effects Bad -Matches are too long by default. Given the fast-paced combat style, the match length should be considerably-shortened, say to something like 4-5 minutes max-Few playable maps and playable modes-Only partial controller support, not full controller support-Poorly-designed main menu. No game title or game art on the main menu-No in-game soundtrack Overall  This game is good, but could have benefited more from a longer development period, prior to launching on Steam. It has the feeling of being rushed.

content:
r 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								I don't even remember how I came across this title, but I'm so glad I did. If you're like me and grew up playing the legendary car combat titles of the 90s (Carmageddon, Twisted Metal, Vigilante 8, etc) you're going to most likely love what Diesel Guns has to offer. Before the game was on Steam Early Access, I had tried the demo on the dev's website. It's improved since then but it can only get better from this point! It's got your typical car combat, power ups galore, environmental hazards similar to what you countered in Vigilante 8 and Twisted Metal, and the game runs buttery smooth on my rig. It even plays nice with an Xbox One controller! The game apparently does have bots that play almost as good as human players, in addition to online play. In it's current state it only has 3 levels to pick from, and 4 different cars. The graphics aren't mind-blowing by any means but they are the best they need to be for this type of game that needs to be fast and not cluttered with a bunch of glitzy effects. I'm going to keep a close eye on this game, and I hope that it becomes a bigger beast. I'll see you on the battlefield!

er 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have just came across this game today and was a little skeptical in whether I should buy and man did I have myself fooled. I do not even have an hour into the game and I can already say this game will be a favorite of mine. The game is very similar to Twisted Metal with a hint of Full Auto. Some of the vehicles in the game resemble the same cars filmed in Death Race. The graphics are decent and like how interactive the environment is. Even though there are 4 maps currently I can see that this game has a lot more on its plate. I would recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of Twisted Metal and would like to relive the good ol' days. Would highly recommend. My $3 well spent.

13
Early Access Review
								Really promising game. Graphics are great, I love the physics (perfect for a vehicle combat game) and weapons are nice and diverse. All it really needs is more cars, arenas, and some game modes like capture the flag or infected (one car starts off as the virus and has to infect the others, they all gang up until one survivor is left).Definitely worth $5 in its current state, especially since multiplayer works if you can find people.
